thread.title: KORT Physical Therapy Opens New Clinic in Versailles, Kentucky
thread.title_full: KORT Physical Therapy Opens New Clinic in Versailles, Kentucky - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: KORT Physical Therapy Opens New Clinic in Versailles, Kentucky
text:
KORT, The Best in Rehab, opens its newest location in Versailles, Kentucky on Monday, October 19. Clinic Director and Physical Therapist Dr. James Escaloni, PT, DPT, OCS, Dip. Osteopractic, Cert. MDT will oversee all operations as well as treat patients.
Versailles, Kentucky (PRWEB) October 23, 2015
Recently, KORT, The Best in Rehab, opens its newest location at 374 Kroger Way in Versailles on Monday, October 19. Clinic Director, Dr. James Escaloni, PT, DPT, OCS, Dip. Osteopractic, Cert. MDT will oversee all operations as well as treat patients
“ Versailles is a growing community and KORT wanted to provide a more convenient, local clinic to better serve area residents. At KORT, we put our patients first making their experience as trouble-free as possible by providing accessible and immediate care in a very cost-effective manner. We’ll bring the same clinical expertise and focus on patient care to this community that KORT has become known for over the past 27 years,” said Escaloni.
The Versailles clinic will be open 8:00 am – 5:00 pm Monday, Wednesday and Friday and
10 am -7 pm Tuesday and Thursday.
The clinic will provide the following services:
Physical Therapy Functional Movement Screen/Selected Functional Movement Assessment Spinal Dysfunction Program TMJ Rehab Industrial Rehab Concussion Management IASTM Sports Medicine Dry Needling Complimentary Consultations
About the Clinic Director
Dr. James Escaloni, PT, DPT, OCS, Dip. Osteopractic, Cert. MDT has been practicing physical therapy since 2007. He graduated with his master’s degree in Physical Therapy from the University of Kentucky in 2007 and his Doctor of Physical Therapy degree (DPT) from Regis University in 2013. James is residency trained and board certified in orthopedics (OCS), and is one of only a handful of certified McKenzie therapists (Cert. MDT) in the state of Kentucky. James is also one of 31 physical therapists in the world to be credentialed with a post-graduate diploma in spinal manipulative therapy and dry needling (Dip. Osteopractic). In addition to his duties as clinic director, he also serves as adjunct faculty for KORT’s Orthopedic Residency Program.
For more information visit http://www.kort.com or call 1-800-645 KORT (5678), or 859- 286-6848to schedule an appointment or a complimentary consultation at the Versailles clinic.
Most health insurance plans now allow patients to seek physical therapy treatment directly without a physician referral.
For over 27 years, Kentucky Orthopedic Rehab Team (KORT) has been the specialist in outpatient physical and occupational therapy in Kentucky and Southern Indiana. Local ownership and independent operations allow our therapists to work one-on-one with patients helping them to regain strength, increase flexibility, improve mobility, and reduce pain without medication or surgery. Selected as a “Best Places to Work in Kentucky” for 11 consecutive years, and with over 40 locations, KORT has the most board certified Orthopedic Specialists and Vestibular Rehabilitation specialists of any other provider in the Commonwealth. KORT’s certified athletic trainers provide services to more than 30 high schools and colleges making us the largest sports medicine provider in the region. KORT has improved more lives by providing compassionate care to more people, in more communities, and in more locations than any other outpatient physical or occupational therapy provider in the state of Kentucky. Through our years of commitment to the physicians and patients of Kentuckiana, KORT is time tested and most trusted.
